main event: The document contains multiple reported UFO sightings between the years 1958 and 1959, with descriptions of fiery objects, round and bright objects, and a metallic object reflecting sunlight, traveling at high speeds and changing colors.
interesting points: On April 9, 1959, at 0342 hours, an observer reported a fiery object at an estimated 2,500 feet altitude, traveling in a northwesterly direction at a high rate of speed. The object was observed for approximately one minute and changed color from orange to white before disappearing.
On February 21, 1958, a metallic object reflecting sunlight was observed flying at high speed at an estimated 600 miles per hour. It maintained a steady glow and course until disappearing from view.
On April 20, 1958, a small light was observed, followed by an abrupt increase in size, round shape, lift from horizontal to vertical, and then descent in a trail, lasting for 4 seconds.
Documents were included in the files of the headquarters, and no further action was contemplated at the time.

A request for information on specific incidents of sightings in 1958 and 1959 in Pennsylvania, Ohio, North Carolina, South Carolina, New York, New Jersey was made to the Executive Officer of the Public Information Division of the Department of the Air Force in 1959.
sighted object: fiery objects, round and bright objects, metallic objects
location: Boston, Ma., Pennsylvania, Ohio, North Carolina, South Carolina, New York, New Jersey
photographs: no photographs included in the document
